antiquities Zahi Hawass said that during the revolt several major artefacts had been stolen from the Egyptian museum, including a statue of Tutankhamun, better known as King Tut. The objects missing from the famed museum include a gilded wood statue of the 18th Dynasty king Tutankhamun being carried by a goddess and parts of another statue showing him harpooning, he said.
